mapper.update:
update qt_financial_product
productName = #{productName},
productCode = #{productCode},
amount = #{amount,jdbcType=DECIMAL},
auditCost = #{auditCost,jdbcType=DECIMAL},
manageCost = #{manageCost,jdbcType=DECIMAL},
dayNum = #{daynum,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
userLevel = #{userlevel,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
isActivated = #{isActivated,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
createdAt = #{createdat,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
createdBy = #{createdby,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
updatedAt = #{updatedat,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
updateBy = #{updateby,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
dayAmount = #{dayAmount}
where id = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.select: select id, productName, productCode, amount, factorageCost,auditCost,manageCost, rate, dayNum, userLevel, isActivated, createdAt, createdBy, updatedAt, updateBy,dayAmount from qt_financial_product where id = #{value}
select id, productName, productCode, amount, factorageCost,auditCost,manageCost, rate, dayNum, userLevel, isActivated, createdAt, createdBy, updatedAt, updateBy,dayAmount from qt_financial_product
mapper.insert: insert into qt_financial_product (id, productName, productCode, amount, auditCost, manageCost, dayNum, userLevel, isActivated, createdAt, createdBy, updatedAt, updateBy,dayAmount) values (#{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{productName,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{productCode,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{amount,jdbcType=DECIMAL},#{auditCost,jdbcType=DECIMAL}, #{manageCost,jdbcType=DECIMAL}, #{daynum,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{userlevel,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{isActivated,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{createdat,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{createdby,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{updatedat,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, #{updateby,jdbcType=VARCHAR},#{dayAmount})
mapper.select: select id, productName, productCode, amount, factorageCost,auditCost,manageCost, rate, dayNum, userLevel, isActivated, createdAt, createdBy, updatedAt, updateBy,dayAmount from qt_financial_product where id like '%${search}%' or productName like '%${search}%' or amount like '%${search}%' or auditCost like '%${search}%' or manageCost like '%${search}%' limit #{start},#{end}
select count(1) from qt_financial_product where id like '%${search}%' or productName like '%${search}%' or amount like '%${search}%' or auditCost like '%${search}%' or manageCost like '%${search}%'
